description: Learn everything about FLUTD in cats: symptoms, emergency signs, treatment options, dietary management, and prevention strategies. A comprehensive guide for cat owners.
metaTitle: FLUTD in Cats: Ultimate Guide to Symptoms, Treatment & Prevention (2026)
metaDescription: Complete guide to Feline Lower Urinary Tract Disease. Learn to recognize symptoms, emergency signs, treatment options, and the best diets for cat urinary health.
faqJson: [{"question":"Can cats recover from FLUTD on their own?","answer":"Mild cases of FIC (idiopathic cystitis) may resolve spontaneously within a week, but the pain is significant, and recurrence is high. Never assume a male cat with symptoms will recover on his own, as a blockage is fatal if untreated."},{"question":"What is the cost of treating a urinary blockage?","answer":"Costs vary by region but typically range from $500 to $3,000 for emergency unblocking and hospitalization. Surgery for stones can be higher. Pet insurance often covers these conditions."},{"question":"Is dry food bad for cats with urinary problems?","answer":"Not necessarily bad, but dry food has low moisture content (approx 10%), whereas wet food has high moisture (approx 75-80%). For cats prone to urinary issues, a wet diet is highly recommended to maintain dilute urine."},{"question":"How can I tell if my cat has crystals or stones?","answer":"You cannot see crystals or stones at home. A veterinarian must perform a urinalysis (to see crystals) or X-rays/ultrasound (to see stones)."}]

metaTitle: Cat Kidney Disease (CKD): Complete Care Guide for Owners (2026)
metaDescription: Comprehensive guide to Chronic Kidney Disease in cats. Learn about IRIS staging, prescription diets, hydration strategies, and home care to help your cat live well.
faqJson: [{"question":"How long can a cat live with CKD?","answer":"It varies widely. A cat diagnosed in Stage 2 may live several years with good management. Cats diagnosed in Stage 4 may have months. Early detection is key."},{"question":"Is dry food bad for cats with kidney disease?","answer":"Dry food is not inherently bad, but its low moisture content is a disadvantage for CKD cats. We strongly recommend a wet-food-based diet to support hydration."},{"question":"Can kidney disease be reversed in cats?","answer":"No. Chronic Kidney Disease involves permanent scarring of the kidneys. The goal of treatment is to slow the progression and manage symptoms, not cure the disease."},{"question":"Are treats okay for CKD cats?","answer":"Only give treats that are low in phosphorus and protein. Many prescription brands make specific renal treats. Avoid generic treats, as they can disrupt the dietary balance."}]
